item.title: Sun Tzu's wisdom in Software Development
item.description: These are some thoughts that came to me after reading this summary of “Deciphering Sun Tzu: How to read The Art of War”.

item.title: “Could you tell me, what is OOP?”
item.description: — So, what is OOP? — It’s a software development paradigm that includes three main principles: inheritance, encapsulation and polymorphism.

item.title: Reactive programming, cellular communication and psychology
item.description: Term Object-Oriented Programming was introduced by Alan Kay in the 60s, as he described his vision of designing complex software systems .
